creator: paul@ensigma.com.au
text:
Sometimes (about 1 in 50) when I restart Apache 2.0.47 (this also happened 
with 2.0.46) on RedHat 9.0, it fails to restart. Here is an exmaple of what is 
reported (Note when I run restart again it work fine). It appears that it is 
trying to start before the previous instance has exited??

[root@inetaus2 php-4.3.3]# /etc/init.d/httpd restart
Stopping httpd: [ OK  ]
Starting httpd: [Fri Sep 12 09:13:54 2003] [warn] module php4_module is 
already loaded, skipping
(98)Address already in use: make_sock: could not bind to address 0.0.0.0:443
no listening sockets available, shutting down
Unable to open logs
[ FAILED ]

[root@inetaus2 php-4.3.3]# /etc/init.d/httpd restart
Stopping httpd: [ FAILED ]
Starting httpd: [Fri Sep 12 09:14:00 2003] [ OK  ]

This is quite problematic for me ask my server gets frequently restarted by a 
script when directory permissions are updated.

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
You should probably start by reporting this to Redhat.

We have no idea what
/etc/init.d/httpd 
is doing.  The documented way to restart apache is
apachectl graceful
or
apachectl restart

creator: paul@ensigma.com.au
text: Point taken.... I'll report it to RedHat. Thanks.

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
Thanks.  Feel free to reopen if it turns out to be a real bug and
you can pinpoint exactly what init.d/httpd is doing.
